title: Conclusions and questions from a non-randomised comparison of routine clinical services implementing different treatment models for borderline personality disorder
abstract: Our study (Barnicot & Crawford 2018) was a non-randomised comparison of outcomes in routine clinical services implementing different treatment models for borderline personality disorder (BPD): mentalization-based therapy (MBT) and dialectical behaviour therapy (DBT). Our studyâ€™s contribution lies primarily in its novelty as currently the only head-to-head comparison of these treatment models, and its potential to generate exploratory findings for further testing in a definitive randomised controlled trial. We thank Luyten and colleagues for their useful commentary.
